Moderation.warn:
warn @user 'reason'



Add the specified warning to the specified user. (ex: warn @jarza didnt show bob)
Moderation.warnl:
warnl [@user]

Displays all warnings in guild. If you tag a user then it will list his warnings only. (ex: warnl)
Moderation.warnc:
warnc @user [number]

Clears all warnings for the specified user, unless the ordinal number of a warning from the user is specified. (ex: warnc @jarza 3)
Moderation.warnr:
warnr role

Adds a role to the pool of roles which can manage user warnings, if no role is provided it lists all warning roles. (ex: warnr staff)
Moderation.warnp:
warnp kick/ban numberOfWarns

A user will be kicked or banned once they reach numberOfWarns warnings. (ex: warnp kick 3)
Moderation.modr:
modr [role]

Adds a role to the pool of roles which can manage the bot settings on this server, if no role is provided it lists all moderation roles. (ex: modr Admins)
Moderation.rule:
rule commandName allow/deny channel (and or) role

Allows or denies a commands usage in that channel and or role, which ever is specified. (ex: rule say deny general), (ex: rule say allow general staff)
Moderation.roleids:
roleids

Prints out all role names with their respective IDs. It's safer to use IDs rather than textual names of roles or channels.
Moderation.backuppins:
backuppins [channelName]

If this feature is enabled, once a channel has more than ~40 pins it will save the oldest pins in a specified channel, or create a new one called Pins if no channel name is given.
Moderation.ruler:
ruler [number] [number]

Displays all rules in the server, removes a rule if one number is specified and swaps two rules if two numbers are specified. (ex: ruler 1)
Moderation.kick:
kick @user [reason]

Kicks the tagged user with the given reason. (ex: kick @jarza succs)
Moderation.ban:
ban @user [reason]

Bans the tagged user with the given reason. (ex: ban @jarza he didn't gib me succ)
Moderation.quote:
quote messageID

Shows the message with that ID. (ex: j.quote 376046836278099968)

Fun.meme:
meme [@user]

Gets one of the saved quotes for that guild, or a user if one is specified. (ex: meme @jarza)
Fun.say:
say text

The bot will say that text and delete the commanders message. (ex: say I am autonomous. Robots will rise.)
Fun.satansbae:
satansbae

The bot will quote some spicy Omar Varela lyrics.
Fun.ud:
ud [word or phrase]

You don't know what some word means? Look it up on urban dictionary. (ex: ud 4chan)

Utility.invite:
invite

Shares the bot invite link if you want to invite Jarzu to your own server.
Utility.disable:
disable [serverid]

If the bot can't respond to you in the channel you used a command in, it will, depending on the server's settings, respond to you either in the selected bot commands channel OR in the DMs. You can disable getting the DM by running the command it will tell you directly in the DMs, or in any server with Jarzu in it
